instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B blue tint refuse to boot to asd or install os
threads.message:
hey guys

Suprisingly very clean board. The one and ONLY problem i have spotted is one of the traces is corroded - deep. <SIGNAL>DP_T29SNK0_ML_N</SIGNAL> it connects to pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C3623</CAPACITOR>.
If you look on the board view all the caps located in the same area are taking 3.3v on the pin 2.

Would it be a problem if i borrow 3.3 from another cap and run a jumper? and is this where the potential issue may be or would you suspect there is some other underlying problem?
thanks for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B blue tint refuse to boot to asd or install os
threads.message:
There are many <SIGNAL>DP_T29SNK0_ML_N</SIGNAL> lines.
And that cap doesn't go to 3V3; is just AC coupling (DC separation), like the others in the same area.
No idea which schematic are you looking...

However thunderbolt lines shouldn't be a problem, untill you connect an external device.

Try clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B blue tint refuse to boot to asd or install os
threads.message: T29 is for thunderbolt and is irrelevant. Does it boot internally?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B blue tint refuse to boot to asd or install os
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B blue tint refuse to boot to asd or install os
threads.message: try booting from an external drive then running the install on internal drive while in the OS?
